page.title: 14THE RIVER AT BOVENEY LOCK
page.content:
Before this lock was called{Boveney {Lock}it was called{Baddie Lock.}Each lock - keeper supervises three miles of water. The lock keeper is{Mr. David {Gibson.}He has to maintain the water level, give a safe passage to the boats; these are the tasks of a lock - keeper.
A boat takes ten minutes maximum to pass through. When a large boat arrives he lets the tugs and barges through first. The busiest time for a lock - keeper is August. Then the average amount of boats that go through in a day is 360. There have only been minor accidents like rope burns and cut arms.
In the winter{Mr. Gibson}has to break some ice and lay down salt.
